channel.title: Help needed: Clicks in granular patch
channel.description: I tried to patch something like the EHX-Freeze Pedal based on a simple granular approach. This is my first patch for axoloti and I am having trouble with clicks during table playback. I tried to use envelopes and fade-in/outs to prevent the clicks, but something is still wrong. Probably it's just a simple error that I just don't see, maybe someone can help. polygrainproto.axp (12.2 KB)

item.title: Help needed: Clicks in granular patch
item.dc:creator: @kausto Kuzma Palkin

item.title: Help needed: Clicks in granular patch
item.dc:creator: @reingarnichts
item.description:
@reingarnichts wrote:

I took a look at the rockafella-patch but it's quite complicated for a beginner and there is a lot of stuff I don't need in there.
I did try table playback with table/read and a saw/lfo though - still clicking.

I think there should be no clicking with correctly placed envelopes - even when retriggering the table/play object.
Is there a minimal example for click-free/windowed table playback?
Shouldn't be that complicated...

Read full topic
item.source: Help needed: Clicks in granular patch

item.title: Help needed: Clicks in granular patch
item.dc:creator: @Blindsmyth Simon
item.description:
@Blindsmyth wrote:

Haven't tested your patch but from the first view I would say try to replace table/play with table/read. The clicks come moste likely from retriggering.
You should also definately check out this thread: https://sebiik.github.io/community.axoloti.com.backup/t/solved-pd-sampler-rockafella-example-on-axoloti/850/18
The rockafella example is pretty great. With tweaking it a little bit I could get pretty close to EHX freeze.

Read full topic
item.source: Help needed: Clicks in granular patch

This is my first patch for axoloti and I am having trouble with clicks during table playback. I tried to use envelopes and fade-in/outs to prevent the clicks, but something is still wrong.
Probably it's just a simple error that I just don't see, maybe someone can help.
